column1: 5384E684-FA81-4F1C-B4D7-7C7868556A5E#appfire#DE659372-D5BB-4929-9169-34A2B6CD3568#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#74061910-C96C-4E62-9353-F686929E876C#appfire#DE659372-D5BB-4929-9169-34A2B6CD3568#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#FE06D2D7-7EC1-4DAE-8CE1-A0B3F703E0F0#appfire#DE659372-D5BB-4929-9169-34A2B6CD3568#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-20 11:00:42.0#appfire#1
